Package embedding

Class DirectEmbedder<T>

java.lang.Object
embedding.Embedder<T>
embedding.DirectEmbedder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to be embedded. The used Measure must also be applicable for this type.
public class DirectEmbedder<T>
extends Embedder<T>
A DirectEmbedder is an Embedder that simply uses the measure for directly calculating the distances. Therefore the DirectEmbedder implements (landmark) MDS.

This implementation can reuses all previous distance calculations. This results in much faster computations if using the DirectEmbedder multiple times. However, this can cause an instance to save a lot of unnecessary data.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Constructor Details

    • DirectEmbedder

      public DirectEmbedder​(T[] elements, Measure<T> measure)
      Constructs a new DirectEmbedder object using the given elements and Measure.

      No landmarks will be used by default. See Embedder(Object[], Measure) more details of the default landmark settings.

      Parameters:
      elements - the elements that are meant to be embedded
      measure - the measure used for the distance calculations
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null

    • DirectEmbedder

      public DirectEmbedder​(T[] elements, Measure<T> measure, int landmarks)
      Constructs a new DirectEmbedder object using the given elements, Measure and landmark count. Landmarks will be used by default.
      Parameters:
      elements - the elements that are meant to be embedded
      measure - the measure used for the distance calculations
      landmarks - the number of landmark points
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null

  • Method Details

    • requiredDistances

      protected double[][] requiredDistances​(int startingPoints)
      Calculated the direct distences between the starting points and all other elements.

      The first entries of elements are used as starting points. The returned distances are positive and symmetric.

      Specified by:
      requiredDistances in class Embedder<T>
      Parameters:
      startingPoints - the number of starting points
      Returns:
      the direct distances from starting points to all other entries. requiredDistances(startingPoints)[i][j] is the distance from the jth starting point to the ith element.
